column4: is it normal for desktop effects to remove window decorations and titlebar?
how did you enable your 3d driver?
i carried it over from a previous upgrade, nvidia-glx
you need to run this: sudo nvidia-xconfig --add-argb-glx-visuals -d 24
had you used the restricted manager you wouldn't have had that problem
cheers, i'll give that a go. will it break my xorg.conf in future upgrades?
will this get in the way of upgrading xorg in future or is this line added anyway when using restricted-manager?
your xorg.conf will no longer be auto-updated
i think i'll do without trying desktop effects in that case.
you could probably use the restricted manager to enable the driver, even if its installed
why is that a big deal anyway?
it already says it is enabled.
this is not my primary machine. i only really keep it to test code i develop in Debian and to follow the Ubuntu project.
i want to leave this machine as un-modified by me as possible.
it's possible that unchecking, rebooting, and rechecking the driver in the restricted manager would enable the lines
